intro: Dichapetalum letestui, commonly known as the Letestu's dichapetalum, is a rare flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It has palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
